title: Black eyed sundal || Healthy snack || Navratri Spl"
content:
Simple recipe: Healthy snack : Black beans sundal Servings : 3 Duration : 10 mins Bored of eating regular snack try this sundal, it's tasty and healthy which contains Black eyed beans, grated coconut & carrot which has high value of vitamin A. It's very simple to prepare all you have to do is Pre Preparation : First soak black eyed beans for 6 hrs or overnight. Cook them in pressure cooker with sufficient water and salt as per taste for 3 whistles, if it is not soft in texture again cook for more 2 whistles. [caption id="attachment_3868" align="alignnone" width="2592"] Soaked black eyed beans for 6 hrs[/caption] Nutrition facts of Black eyed beans : Vitamin : A, C & B6 Minerals: Iron, calcium, Magnesium, potassium, protein and good in fiber Today, I prepared black eyed beans sundal which is easy to prepare and tasty too. It contains cooked black eyed beans, grated coconut, carrot ðŸ¥•Â with tempering. Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: Black eyed beans - 240 gms Powdered coconut/ fresh grated coconut - 2 tb sp Grated carrot - 2 tb sp Coriander - chopped - 2 tb sp For Tempering: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1/2 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1/2 tea spoon Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1/2 tea spoon Curry leaves - 4 to 5 Dry Red chillies - 2 Asafoetida/ Hing - 1/8 teaspoon Oil - 2 tb sp Procedure:
  • Heat pan on medium heat
  • Add oil & tempering
  • Let them splutter & saute
  • Add cooked black eyed beans
  • Give it a toss
  • Saute 30 secs. Don't over cook because black eyed beans already cooked
  • Add powdered coconut and Saute
  • Switch off burner/ cooktop
  • Add grated carrot & chopped coriander
  • Saute gently
  • Offer Black eyed beans to Godess Durga Mata
  • You can serve it hot as a evening snack
  • Happy cooking ðŸ˜Š
